result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lirim Mahmudi

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM Defendant Lirim Mahmudi in court.  Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Lirim Mahmudi.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Adjmt request.  Atty Foster has JE. Granted.  JS 1/23 830am.  JSH 1/19 11am. Bond continued.  STD may be filed after next trial date if trial does not go forward.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury selection scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Foster.   Clerk HMcBride. Trial scheduled. JSH 10/27 11am. JS 11/14 830am.   Speedy Trial Demand to be filed.  Atty Foster does not object to the November trial date as scheduled.  Bond continued.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

03:07 PM  
  Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
